data.title: Mayor Kapszukiewicz endorses Toledo City Council District 5 candidate Sam Melden
meta_keywords: Local government in the United States
data.meta_description: Ahead of the Sept. 10 primary with five open Toledo City Council seats, Mayor Wade Kapszukiewicz publicly endorsed District 5 hopeful Sam Melden Tuesday morning. The mayor, a resident of District 5, feels that he shares the same value and commitment to the district he and Melden both live in and to Toledo as a whole. Melden, 35, is currently the director of strategic engagement for The Ability Center of Toledo.
data.text:
Ahead of the Sept. 10 primary with five open Toledo City Council seats, Mayor Wade Kapszukiewicz publicly endorsed District 5 hopeful Sam Melden Tuesday morning.

The mayor, a resident of District 5, feels that he shares the same value and commitment to the district he and Melden both live in and to Toledo as a whole.

Melden, 35, is currently the director of strategic engagement for The Ability Center of Toledo. He is running as a Democrat and his vision for District 5 is keeping neighborhoods safe, strong and sustainable.

"I believe they're neighborhoods, safe, strong sustainable neighborhoods that give us an opportunity to raise our families and age in place and live the full life that we want to live here in this amazing city," Melden said.

Other candidates for District 5 include Connor Kelley, Tom Names and Shane Logan. Tom Waniewski, the current District 5 council member, was not able to file for 2019 re-election due to term limits.
